content: slip the marker from the lh to the rh needle each time you come to it band round 1 *k1-p1 repeat from * to the end of the round band rounds 2 and 3 as for band round 1 rounds 1-26 work 26 rounds of stocking stitch incorporating some sort of design e g stripes fair isle christmas trees santas snowflakes baubles some charts are included at the end of the pattern but use any design you like there are lots of ideas on pinterest be aware that designs with a 12 15 20 or 30 st pattern repeat are ideal as they fit easily with the 60 sts of the main body with the charts below the first 30 sts on the chart reading from right to left will be the back of the sweater and the second 30 sts will be the front this is important if you want a specific design placement for example the paper cut dolls chart as written places 2 boys & 1 girl on the front and 2 girls and 1 boy on the back note that the bor marker is at the side of the sweater not at the center back so place/center your chosen design accordingly the 15th and 16th sts after the bor marker are the center back sts of the sweater center front and center back sts are indicated below each chart lastly you will notice that some charts have more row than others i haven t indicated how many rounds to knit before starting a chart just place them where you think they will look good make sure to finish round 26 at the bor marker next we work back and forth on half 30 the sts rather than in the round divide for sleeves and work on the front 6 row set aside the bor stitch marker turn your work so that the wrong side is facing you row 27 ws loosely cast on 4 sts then purl 4+30 = 34 sts turn your work ready to knit the next row this is the front of the sweater 34 sts mrs rose designs… 2 this pattern is for your personal use only © mrsrosedesigns1@gmail com christmas bunting sweater row 28 rs loosely cast on 4 sts then knit to the end of the row turn 38 sts row 29 loosely cast on 4 sts purl to the end of the row turn 42 sts row 30 loosely cast on 4 sts knit to the end of the row turn 46 sts row 31 loosely cast on 4 sts purl to the end of the row turn 50 sts row 32 loosely cast on 4 sts p3 the sleeve band k until 3 sts remain p3 54 sts sleeves and cuff ribbing 4 row row 33 purl row 34 p3 k until 3 sts remain p3 row 35 purl row 36 p3 k until 3 sts remain p3 54 sts ribbed neckband 3 row note if making for
